Fields.DialogueText: "Dear Takao, I am writing to thank you for your last letter. The war has not been easy for anyone, but Chikuma and I have learned a great deal about each other."
"Dear Takao, Chikuma reminds me that it's impolite not to write back to you in response to your last letter even though it's vastly easier to talk to you by..."
*ALARM*
Captain, we need you on the bridge!
@BATTLE
Now to finish my letter.... Let me get out the pen and paper again.
Ohayou gozaimasu!
This is kind of a strange question, but: have you seen my pen? I was writing a letter before the enemy came, and I certainly had it then - but now it seems to have scarpered.
I haven't seen it, no. This seems a little bit odd.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, it really is. I left it right here.
Help me look for it, would you?
Oh, well. I'll probably find it when I least expect it.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe you should look around for it.
I've got to be back on the bridge in a few minutes, Kanchou - but if you're still looking for it when I'm off duty, I'll be happy to help.
I hope so, Kanchou.
Thank you. Anyway, what did you need?
Actually, I lost something too.
What did you lose?
My necklace.
Yeah, probably not.
And ohayou to you too!
... Actually, the letter's gone too. Unless I threw it out and forgot about it.
Hello, Chikuma. Mr. Kishibe.
What are you two up to?
Kishibe is telling me about what it's like to be dead.

Fields.MenuText: ... But he's clearly alive.
What do you mean?
Dead man walking!

Fields.DialogueText: Luckily, he is alive now because he was revived. When he was injured, there was a period when his heart stopped beating for long enough that he could technically be considered dead.
When Kishibe was injured, there was a period of time when his heart stopped beating. Of course, the medics were able to revive him.
When he was in the sick bay, his heart stopped beating for a long time. So, technically, he was dead before being revived.
That's pretty amazing.
I do believe I'm a lucky man.
So lucky!
...and I have Chikuma to thank for it.
*ALARM*
Get ready!
Let's go!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All crew report to your stations!
Here you are. Hello, Chikuma, Kishibe.
Hello, Kanchou! We're talking about Kishibe's experience again.

Fields.MenuText: Fair enough. If you don't mind repeating yourself, what was it like to be dead, Kishibe?
Maybe you should write a book about it.
Sorry - I didn't mean to interrupt a personal discussion.

Fields.DialogueText: Well...
It's so hard to put into words. I'm not sure I could. It's... okay, let me try again.
No, no - it's fine! Hey, Kishibe, isn't it fine?
Being dead, or nearly dead, I saw everything I'd ever done in front of me, like a bunch of photographs on a table.
Oh, go on.
Then I felt a warm light, which seemed like everything anyone could ever know in one force. Then the medic started calling my name, and I came back.
And Chikuma, I felt bonded to her. When she was doing whatever she did, pushing the darkness off the ship, it was like she was inside my head.
I do feel a connection to you, Kishibe.
There was one more thing. I saw an eye closing. It wasn't my eye - just a strange eye.
The strange eyes? I had seen them in my dream before Chikuma expelled the bad spirits from the ship. Other crew members saw them too.
That's not something I would have ever believed before all of this happened to me, but now...
It's different.
@BATTLE
Kanchou!
Uh... sure. I don't know that it's all that interesting, though.
And it's so hard to put into words. I'm not sure I could. It's... okay, let me try again.
Chikuma!
Right here, Kanchou. How can I help?
It's nothing too major. I hope. I was just wondering if you ever found your necklace.
No. I seem to have run out of places to look for it, too.

Fields.MenuText: Hm. I could never find my pen.
Do you think someone took your necklace?
Right. We need to start considering the possibility of theft.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry about your pen. Maybe you can get a new one. I don't think I can get a new necklace.
It's possible, but I don't know who would do such a thing on our crew.
Do we? I can't imagine any of my crew being so bad.
Your necklace, was it valuable?
It sure was valuable to me.
What do you mean?
Well...
*ALARM*
I'll tell you later, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
"Dear Takao, I'm writing you to..."
Kanchou...
Oh, Chikuma. What's up?
I hope I'm not disturbing you, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: No, not at all. You, Chikuma, never bother me. What's the matter?
You only disturb me in the best possible ways. What can I do for you?
No, I'm just rewriting this damn letter. What is it?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Kanchou! I was going to tell you about the necklace I lost.
In the best-?
Well... if you have a moment? You were interested before in my missing necklace.
Right. You were saying it was valuable to you?
It's... well, for me, it's a symbol of Japan. I know it sounds silly, but....
That's not silly at all. Listen, what does it look like? I'll help you find it.
It has a cute little deer on the end.
Okay. What does that symbolize?
Well, actually, the deer is just very cute. It's the inscription on the other side that really symbolizes Japan - for me, at least.
*ALARM*
We'll find that necklace, Chikuma. No matter how many interruptions we have to fight through.
@BATTLE
Um. Oh, I was going to tell you about the necklace!
It... oh. Oh, dear.
Captain!
Officer Guzman, I wanted to ask you...
Captain, I believe we have an urgent issue. Possible Morgana sightings.
Right. Set course to pursue. If this is real, I want--
*ALARM*
There they are!
Well, that was efficient, anyway.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant - hold on a moment. I wanted to ask you if you'd seen a necklace.
A what?
My deer necklace - have you seen it?
Sorry! Sorry! Still not used to the... suddenly appearing thing.

Fields.MenuText: It becomes kind of endearing once you get used to it.
Well, hello, Chikuma. We were just talking about you.
I don't think he's seen it, Chikuma.

Fields.DialogueText: Aw. Thank you, Kanchou.
Hai! I know. That's why I appeared.
Oh, I guess he hasn't...
Chikuma, how could we be losing things when you seem to know about everything that happens on this ship?
I don't see everything all the time, Kanchou. It's like... how often do you really pay attention to your toes if they're not in pain?
GAH!
Right.
I'm going to do you the favor of treating that as a rhetorical question, by the way.
Why? Is there something wrong with your toes? Can I help?
... Can I go now?
Now I may finally be able to finish writing this letter.
Except all my new pens are gone too.
This is too strange.
It's time to start demanding answers from the crew, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Agreed. We clearly have a problem here.
Let's not jump to conclusions.
Unless it's Morgana "spirits" again.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. And we'll solve it together.
I'm not jumping. I'm strolling toward conclusions at a reasonable pace.
Hm. Let's eliminate the more obvious explanations first.
I'll assemble the crew.
*ALARM*
I just noticed you have a little facial tic when you're frustrated.
@BATTLE
Do I? How delightful.
Captain. Enemy's almost in range.
Everyone brace yourselves. We'll be hearing from them any second now.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant.
Captain?
There's no good way to ease into this - Chikuma and I have both had things go missing. The losses haven't been of any operational significance--
I'm not sure I agree.
So, in Chikuma's case, there's real sentimental value in what's been taken. Obviously.

Fields.MenuText: I wasn't finished!
Fair enough.
I'm just saying, no military secrets have gone missing.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Sorry, Kanchou.
Moreover, the thefts - and I'm assuming they are thefts - have been brazen. Correspondence has been snatched from my desk.
Uh, pardon my French, Captain. Ma'am.
Nani? Was that French?
I'll tell you later.
We've had more reports than usual of things going wandering, but I hadn't really been thinking crime wave. Stealing from the Captain, though....
We really need to talk to the full crew.
Lieutenant, if you could set that up...
On it, Captain.
Attention, crew!
Nē, kiite! Listen up!
This is war. It's unfortunate that such questions need to be asked, but I'm afraid... I'm not sure if this is due to national rivalry... I'm not sure.
Ah, just say it.

Fields.MenuText: Things around this ship have been going missing. If they're returned to my office in the next twenty-four hours, that'll be the end of it.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding, but we have to ask. Have any of you been collecting our items without permission?
Who took my pens? Who took Chikuma's necklace?!

Fields.DialogueText: If they're not returned, things will be a lot more serious!
It's unacceptable to have a thief fighting alongside us.
Who would do such a thing?!
So, no one has anything to volunteer?
*ALARM*
Oh! Prepare for battle.
@BATTLE
Captain, I have some news that might be interesting to you.
Go on, Guzman.
Is this about the thief?

Fields.MenuText: Oh, hi.
Give the man a little more room to breathe, Chikuma.
Yes, Officer Guzman, is it about the thief?

Fields.DialogueText: Hello to you too, Kanchou.
Oh. Gomen nasai. I just--
I really want to get to the bottom of this.
*ALARM*
Morganas again!
@BATTLE
Officer Guzman!
Yes, Captain?
Continue what you were saying before. Would it happen to be about the missing items?
Yes, Captain. First, I noticed my favorite drinking glass had disappeared. Then I heard from an anonymous crewmember who told me that he had seen the same kind with another crewmember.
Who is the crewmember suspected of being the thief?
Her name is Elizaveta Mihaelova. I don't know her well - she's a fairly new arrival.
Um...
Hm. I think I remember her face, but I don't know much about her either.
Sounds like it might be a good idea to correct that.
Chikuma!
Kanchou? How can I help?
We seem to have a suspect.
We should act now, Kanchou!
*ALARM*
Well. Here we go again.
Indeed.
@BATTLE
No help required - but thank you. I just wanted to give you an update.
We are - or Guzman is.
He's undertaking a very quiet investigation of Ensign Mihaelova. We don't want to tip her off if she's guilty, and we don't want to cast suspicion on her if she's innocent.
I can help!

Fields.MenuText: I know. For a start, what do you know about Mihaelova?
I know. We're just waiting for word from the Lieutenant.
You really don't like waiting, do you?

Fields.DialogueText: She's young. She was on an Orfey-class destroyer - Stalin, I think - before she came to us.
Do we know why she made the jump? Any problems with her old crew?
On the contrary - she seems to have been well-liked. But she got a promotion and a small pay rise when she switched over, and she wanted to work on her language skills...
Could she be a spy?
A spy who got caught stealing pens?
Point taken.
Hai.
So... how are you doing? Missing necklace notwithstanding.
I'm good!
... I'm always afraid to ask how you're doing.

Fields.MenuText: That's okay. I'm always fine.
Probably wise. The complaining would never stop.
Why?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. I know. But you just take so much work on yourself. It must be very lonely.
I'm serious, though.
You... just take so much work on yourself. It must be very lonely.

Fields.MenuText: You just heard me say I was making Guzman do all the work, right?
... Sometimes.
No. I know I'm not alone. You always come when I call.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou...
Chikuma?
Right here, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Are you okay?
Good. What's the situation?
Nothing, really. I just like it when you appear like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry. I have no intention of sinking anytime soon. I... hope you came through the battle in good health as well.
Things seem to be under control at the infirmary, Kanchou. And the last of the smaller fires should be out at any moment.
Oh...
Captain? Sorry to interrupt, but I have some news about Mihaelova.
Very good.
I guess that's one way of looking at it. We have evidence linking her to the crimes - our anonymous tipster has struck again.
What is the evidence?
Look here.
My pen!
It was found in her quarters - under her bunk, actually.
Who found it? Our anonymous source?
Correct.
Are those Morganas I'm seeing on the horizon, or is just a mirage that-
*ALARM*
Yeah, okay.
@BATTLE
You agree not to sink, I agree not to get blown up. Fair?
Hai.
And you're okay?
That makes me a little bit uneasy.
Well... without going into the details, Captain, I feel very strongly that the person in question didn't plant evidence.
Hm. Noted. And thank you for the pen.
Ah, Chikuma, this is what you're working on now?
Hai! My newest print!
This is traditional woodblock work? And you can keep your hands steady enough to pull it off on the open sea? Color me impressed.
If you tell me what color that is, exactly, I'll see what I can do.
Heh.

Fields.MenuText: What you're working on now is legitimately excellent. You could be the next Hasui.
It seems peaceful.
I'm surprised you have the patience for this.

Fields.DialogueText: It is nothing much, Kanchou.
Hai. I find it very relaxing.
It is good to take some time to slow your mind, Kanchou.
Kanchou...
*ALARM*
... We should probably-
Hai! I'll see you on the bridge!
I don't like to brag, but I must admit - I was hoping to impress you.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I'm impressed.
Chikuma...
That's fair. You'd be surprised at how much of what I do is meant to impress you.

Fields.DialogueText: @BATTLE
Chikuma!
Chikuma!
Chikuma, there you are.
Oh, yes, Kanchou. I do apologize. I was further discussing the experience of near death with Kishibe.

Fields.MenuText: Interesting. What did he say?
You were talking to him again?
He must be a fascinating conversationalist.

Fields.DialogueText: He said many things about the strange dreams he sometimes has now.
Well, yes... I suppose I like to talk to him sometimes. Not too much, though. There may be other people on the ship I like to talk to more.
Are you saying...? It's not like that, Kanchou!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Chikuma!
Hai?
I meant to speak with you about the theft matter earlier. What do you think about all this?
Honestly, Kanchou... I'm not sure about the Elizaveta theory.
Why's that?
It's peculiar. Why would she steal things that are so small, like pens or a drinking glass?
Right.
And I do wonder who this anonymous crew member is.
I'm sorry. There was a tone in my voice that wasn't supposed to be there, and I'd really appreciate it if you just pretended it wasn't.
But you don't have to-
Hold that thought.
Agreed.
I can't help but notice that you haven't brought her in for questioning yet.
No. I'm probably overthinking it, but... if there's a trap here, I don't want to walk into it. Maybe somebody's looking to drive a wedge between us and the Soviet crew members, or....
With a stolen pen?
I know. Just... quietly keep an eye on her if you can, okay?
Hai! I can do that.
Oh, Chikuma, hello.
At ease.
Kanchou, I just wanted to tell you that you have the ship running very smoothly. In my opinion. Which is correct.

Fields.MenuText: Oh?
Thanks, Chikuma. I couldn't do it without you.
If you're buttering me up for a favor, it's working.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai, hai. I'm very impressed by you.
It is nothing, Kanchou.
What? I'm not! Can't a Belle just tell her kanchou what she's thinking about?
Okay, much as I hate to change the subject from my own excellence, I have to ask - what are your feelings about Mihaelova at this point? Spotted her with your necklace, by any chance?
Is it possible that she's being framed?
It's possible.
Maybe the real thief has the necklace.
The plot thickens.
Oh. I'm afraid not, Kanchou - I would have told you if I had.
I figured as much. Still - any impressions you care to share?
She's a hard worker, her language skills are formidable, and I've seen her pass up opportunities to steal unattended objects. It doesn't prove she's innocent, but...
But you don't think she's guilty.
Next question: if she's being framed, have you spotted anyone likely to be doing the framing? Anyone paying particular attention to her - watching her without wanting to be noticed?
Kanchou, the thing is... a few men pay attention to her, and I wouldn't be able to say if any of them want anything unusual.
Mm. Maybe that's an angle worth considering - some sailor who feels rejected framing her just out of spite?
Or someone jealous of the attention she's getting trying to drive her off the ship?
Possible. Though, really, both hypotheses involve someone taking a lot of risk with fairly little guarantee of satisfying reward.
Hai. I'll keep watching over her, then?
Please do. And thank you.
Chikuma?
What news?
Kanchou, the news is that there is no news. Ensign Mihaelova is a clear asset to the crew, and I can attest to the character of the crew members most interested in her comings and goings.

Fields.MenuText: Okay. Every hypothesis we eliminate brings us one step closer to the truth.
I do trust your judgment - but you're putting a lot of weight on belief without much concrete proof.
I have mixed feelings. If we don't have a disturbed thief with personal motives, then we might have a bigger problem.

Fields.DialogueText: That's a good way to look at it, Kanchou.
Hai. I know.
Okay. I didn't want to question Ensign Mihaelova directly because I didn't want to tip anyone off. I'm starting to think I was being too clever for our own good. Do you have an opinion?
I'm not saying we shouldn't talk to her - but I think it might be more interesting to hear from Lieutenant Guzman's anonymous source.
You're right. As always.
Ah! I'm glad you think so.
*ALARM*
Yeah, that figures.
@BATTLE
Hai. Right here, Kanchou. It seemed time for another report on my observations.
In short, I don't believe she is our thief, and I don't believe her admirers are acting maliciously toward her.
I don't think it's done any harm, Kanchou. I don't think she knows anything was ever around her bunk to begin with, let alone how it got there.
Don't look so surprised.
It's not so much that I'm surprised. I just like it when you praise me.
Chikuma, I could do it for hours at a time.
Well, if you-
Hey, Lieutenant. I need to have a few words with you.
Yes, Captain?
Is it about Ensign Mihaelova?
Yes and no. We have doubts about her guilt.
What doubts could you have? I caught her red handed.
What, Captain?
I thought you said that you had an anonymous source.
Well, yes... but then I was the one who checked her quarters.
I overheard you two discussing Elizaveta.
You should tell Officer Guzman your opinion.
Hai. I don't think that Elizaveta is the real thief. The items in her room were put there by someone else.
Don't take this the wrong way, ma'am - but how do you figure?
For a start, the only suggestion of any kind that she's involved is a handful of pens strewn under her bunk. The only stolen item of any real value is nowhere to be seen.
... Okay, when you put it like that-
*ALARM*
Looks like it will have to wait.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant Guzman? I understand you have something to report.
If this is a good time.
The enemy's still a few minutes out, and just standing here waiting isn't my favorite situation in the world. What've you got?
Your thought that Elizaveta is being framed seems plausible to me now.
Why's that?
I went to speak to her at night...
Yes, and?
I saw someone trying to walk into her quarters.
Who was it?
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Guzman!
Right. Our thief.
Yes.
Lieutenant Guzman, who did you see trying to get into Elizaveta Mihaelova's room?
It was Kishibe, Captain.
... Right. Let's continue this conversation when Chikuma's done helping with the wounded. She's going to want to be a part of it.
So, it would seem that Kishibe is the new primary suspect.
Huh. Captain, maybe I should...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
I really don't think it could be Kishibe.
Chikuma, I trust your intuitions about the ship but...
But what?
Yeah, I have to make the obvious point: the Neutrality Fleet's fraternization rules are almost nonsensical - pardon my editorializing - and we're not making a priority out of enforcing them.
So, basically, I can think of some obvious reasons why a young man might visit a young woman after dark.
Sure. The thing is... Captain, he was behaving really strangely. He didn't knock. He didn't slow down to introduce himself. He was just in and out of a dark room in under two minutes.
... Okay, that's legitimately odd.
Chikuma, you know him better than I do. Any thoughts?
I know he's not a criminal, Kanchou.
I'll buy that. Tentatively. But can you guarantee he's not under outside influence?
You think this is like before?
I think the crimes are disorganized and weird. And I think last time around Kishibe was the worst affected of all of us.
I would observe that our last primary suspect turned out to have been framed. And she actually had stolen items in her quarters.
I don't mean any disrespect, Lieutenant, but from what you saw Kishibe could just have been bringing the Ensign a book.

Fields.MenuText: You know we're not going to railroad the man. Hell, Mihaelova didn't even know she was a suspect.
Chikuma, he might need help.
But you need to trust *us*.

Fields.DialogueText: Absolutely.
Not to mention the rest of the crew.
Yeah. We're all on the same side, ma'am.
Kanchou. Funayūrei are massing to the south.
Right. Get us a course to engage.
@BATTLE
Chikuma, hello.
Kanchou...
What is it, Chikuma?
Before we go any further with Kishibe, there's one loose end I think we should address.
Loose... ah. The anonymous source?
Hai.

Fields.MenuText: Fine with me. That was always weird.
You're not comfortable surveilling Kishibe, I take it?
Agreed. I get the sense that Guzman is more embarrassed than guilty - but he's been hiding something here.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigatō.
I... will always do my duty, Kanchou.
"Embarrassed?" Interesting, Kanchou.
Hang on. Lieutenant - we'd like a word!
Captain?
Chikuma and I have been talking about loose ends, and the subject of your anonymous source came up. I think it's time you came clean.
It's you, isn't it?

Fields.MenuText: Wait. Is it?
It's him.
Okay, let the man speak.

Fields.DialogueText: I... ah, hell. Yes. It's me.
Explain.
I'm sorry, Captain. I just wanted to take my motives out of the equation and deal with the fact of the stuff found in her quarters, and this seemed... easiest.
Not an explanation.
She's a beautiful multilingual communist, Captain. I thought she was a spy from the first second she stepped on board. When something went wrong, I took it upon myself to search her quarters.
That's the long and the short of it. Once I spent a few days officially watching her, my suspicions basically evaporated - but there was still the business of my glass under her bunk. And your pens.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, for #$^#'s sake.
It'll save us all a lot of stress if you're just honest and open from the start in future.
You're an idiot. But I respect that you took initiative here.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Captain.
Sorry, Captain.
I think it's the "idiot" part that stands out most, to be honest.
I'm going to find a way to rap your knuckles over this, Lieutenant - but I do appreciate your candor.
In future, though, please tell me if you think we have a spy on board.
Yes, ma'am.
Okay. Now it's time we talk to Kishibe.
Kanchou...
I'm really worried we're looking at something more than petty theft here, Chikuma. This is for his own sake as much as anyone else's.
Kanchou? Kishibe is on his way.
Good. You're welcome to stay, of course. In fact, I hope you do.
But if it would be uncomfortable to confront someone you're close to, I'd understand.
... You do know he and I are just friends, right?

Fields.MenuText: Noted.
I didn't want to ask.
Well, good.

Fields.DialogueText: Chikuma?
I'm sorry, Kanchou. I've really let you down, haven't I?
I'm sorry. What?
I was supposed to have saved Kishibe - my friend! - and I've talked to him for hours about his dreams, and I just... it took you and Lieutenant Guzman two minutes to figure it all out.
Me? How many weeks has it been?
Chikuma...
It's all right, Kanchou. This isn't about me. I just need you to know that I know I've failed you, and the crew, and I'm not going to let it happen again. I swear it.

Fields.MenuText: You're overreacting. I get it, but you shouldn't be so hard on yourself.
Okay.
That's the dumbest thing I've heard this week.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou...
Listen, there's been no sabotage. Kishibe doesn't seem to be suffering. No lives have been lost.
This is all strange, and I want it fixed - but if Morganas can influence members of my crew, I can't think of a more benign way we could've found out, assuming that's even what's going on.
And don't think anyone's forgotten how much worse things were before your exorcism - or whatever that was.
I think half this crew would be gone now without your protection, and I'm not going to let you forget it.
... Kanchou, may I ask you a question?
Please.
I... felt like you were starting to flirt with me a little, before all this started, and then as it dragged on, you stopped. Was that all my imagination?

Fields.MenuText: ... The part about stopping isn't quite right.
I hope I never made you uncomfortable.
If I stopped flirting with you, it was because other things got in the way. When those things are resolved, you and I should talk.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh. Oh!
No! Not at all! I... appreciated it. I just wanted to....
At length.
*ALARM*
Really? REALLY?!
I... guess we'll have to talk to Kishibe later.
H-hai.
@BATTLE
Kishibe.
What are you doing?
Kishibe, what are doing with those lady's boots?
Captain, what's wrong with Kishibe?
I don't know. He may just sleepwalking, but - remember when he was sick? He was able to feed himself, but...
Kishibe! What's wrong with you? Come here.
*slap*
Aaaaah, what...? What's going on?
That's what I'd like to know.
Give me those boots, Kishibe. They can't belong to you.
Oh, yes, of course. I...
What's going on? What do you remember?
I haven't the foggiest, Kanchou. Last I recall I was asleep. I remember having another one of those strange dreams.
I'm not surprised. I'm so sorry, Kishibe - I should have realized sooner. Gomen nasai.
Lieutenant, can you tell whose boots these are?
The inscription says... I can't tell. It's in Russian.
Maybe they're Elizaveta's. They look like hers.
Huh. Lieutenant Guzman, please escort our friend here to somewhere secure. Chikuma and I will want to talk to him in a few minutes.
Yes, Captain. Come on, Kishibe - let's get some coffee in you. I don't want you going back to sleep just yet.
Sure, but... what's going on?
So. Kanchou, with your permission, I'll repeat my previous banishing. I think only a lingering Funayūrei touch remains in his mind - I hope it can be dislodged with one last effort.
Kanchou - ssh. He's over here.
This isn't that bad, Kanchou. There's something wrong here, but it's nothing like the hatred that was swallowing him back then.
Hooray for Belle senses.
You tell me, buddy.
Is it safe?
Oh, he'll sleep through it.
No, I mean, is it safe for you? Last time you were sealed away in your room for days. And just a whiff of whatever you were fighting with put Guzman down on the floor in seconds.
I'm not Lieutenant Guzman.
And that's why I like flirting with you. But please answer my question.
Kanchou... it doesn't matter. This has to be done.
Stop. It matters to me.
*ALARM*
Right. Don't do anything about Kishibe until we've had a chance to talk!
Hai.
@BATTLE
Huh.
I'm very sorry about all this, by the way.
Not your fault.
Listen, I think I know the answer to this, but - do you have any idea what happened to Chikuma's necklace?
I don't. I'm sorry.
I understand. I just... hrm. We don't have the sense that you're being directed with particular malice - just that something's tickling your subconscious mind and making you act strangely.
Kanchou... I can't paint while people watch me. It's embarrassing!

Fields.MenuText: I'll turn around and face a wall the whole time.
You're not painting for fun. This is a military exercise to protect our crew - and I'm not leaving you unprotected.
Hey. I'm not "people."

Fields.DialogueText: That just makes it worse!
Chikuma, the last time you did one of these exorcisms it was like a gas attack on your quarters. I'm not going to just walk away and plan to come back in a week to see if you asphyxiated.
Oh, but the clouds aren't harmful, Kanchou. They're just a byproduct of gathering the Funayūrei's poison and destroying it. Really, you could say it was a sign things were going well!
It almost knocked out Guzman in under a minute.
Hee.
What?
It's just, the last time we had this conversation, I reminded you I wasn't Guzman and you said something about flirting with me.
No. See, I see what you're doing, but you're not going to distract me from the basic point of not wanting to send you into danger alone.
Kanchou, I'm not lying, and I'm not exaggerating. I can't do what I have to do with you in the room, and since it has to be done you're eventually going to agree.
So wouldn't you rather talk about something else in the meantime?

Fields.MenuText: ... I feel like there's been a fundamental misunderstanding about who's supposed to be in charge here.
No.
If you want me to take a moment to reflect on your beauty and charm, I'm happy to do it. It's not going to make me more likely to feed you to the enemy, though.

Fields.DialogueText: Probably.
This just makes me like you more, you realize.
You think I'm beautiful and charming!
Chikuma.
Kanchou, the process of what I have to do isn't easy to describe. Just please believe me when I say that if you were with me, the Funayūrei would strike at you to distract me.
And... I find you somewhat distracting to begin with.
... Well.
Kanchou?
This probably isn't the first time that my desire to protect someone I care about has gotten in the way of my common sense. You're right, of course.
But I would very much like to find a way for you to call for help if you need it.
But you're my kanchou. Don't you understand? If I need you, you'll know.
Chikuma... would I be totally out of line if I tried to ki--
*ALARM*
... I hate these things so much.
@BATTLE
Kishibe? How are you doing?
I have to sleep in the brig so I don't steal things or hurt people, Kanchou. It's not a great feeling.
With all due respect, that's bad enough.
Yeah. But you never really tried to hurt anybody - you should know that if you haven't already been told - and I don't think you'd've thrown the necklace into the sea.
I just don't know, Kanchou.
... How long has it been since you've slept?
I don't know. I'm trying very hard not to sleep. It's not like I have to be fresh for flying.
I understand. But get some rest anyway - we'll keep you safe. Captain's orders.
Kishibe, sorry to bother you. I just have one more question.
Yes, Kanchou?
Why were you taking things to Elizaveta's quarters? You seemed to be there a lot, maybe more than other places.
Well...
I guess I should just come right out and say it. I'm in love with her. Sometimes I go there.
Relax. As long as nobody's pregnant and I'm not having to break up fights between jealous sailors on deck, I've got bigger problems to worry about.
Well, this has been helpful, Kishibe. Thank you.
*ALARM*
Kanchou, it's done.
Okay. Well done, Chikuma. Very well done.
What?
Here.
My necklace! Thank you so much, Kanchou. I'm so relieved!
Where did you find it?
Kishibe's plane. He told me he was in love with Elizaveta, and that got me thinking that maybe he was just taking things to places where he felt... safe, maybe? Happy?
Oh, Kanchou...
So what does the inscription say? You said it reminds you of Japan.
It says, "My heart is heavy for you."
It's not like it's going to get me in any more trouble than I'm in already, right?
@BATTLE
What's done?
I perfected the seal. While the Funayūrei were realigning themselves in the region after that last battle, I just... did it.

Fields.MenuText: And perfecting the seal is... good?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! It means Kishibe can sleep in peace!

Fields.MenuText: Wait - are you saying Kishibe is free from these things now?

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! He should be!

Fields.MenuText: You could've told me you were going to do that, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: I know. Gomen! But you were helping to put out a fire, and the window for action was very small.
... But it worked? Kishibe is himself again after dark?
I was all set to be worried for you for days. I guess now I just have to worry about you getting shot.
Or you could try relaxing.
Did that once. Didn't like it.
*sigh*
Anyway. It's an anticlimax now, but there's one other development you might want to be aware of.
I was able to guess from the way you're, y'know, dancing.
He was protecting them.
It's just an educated guess. We'll probably never know.
"Dear Takao, It's been too long..."
Oh, Chikuma...
Kanchou, I see you're finally writing the letter now that you have your pen back. I'm sorry to disturb you here in your quarters. I saw that the door was closed, but...
I'm glad that didn't stop you.
Oh. I... I mean, I hoped you'd feel that way. Obviously.
I need somebody to steal my pen again.
*ahem*
Is this... about Kishibe? We're keeping him under observation for another few nights, but there's every indication that your "perfected seal" is doing the job.
I'm so glad! But... no. This isn't about Kishibe.
The other day, you were... I think you were starting to ask if....
I think you have a pretty good idea of what I was starting to ask.
Oh.
... Just to be clear, it was kissing, right?
Something along those lines, yes.
Hai. Good.
Good?
If... if you want to ask me the question again, Kanchou...
*ALARM*
Thismaynotbethebesttimegottago!
*ALARM*
*ALARM*
Damn Morganas.
@BATTLE
